results.title: Stanislavsky: maker of the modern theater
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Films for the Humanities and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Explores the life, times and ideas of the theatrical innovator, Constantine Stanislavsky, who created method acting and founded the Moscow Art Theatre. Uses documentary footage, photographs, and dramatisations to show his memorable roles, his search for reality in character portrayal, and his staging of plays of Chekhov, Ostrovsky, Ibsen, Maeterlinch, Gorki and Turgeniev. Narrated by Paul Rogers.

results.title: Stani the tortoise
results.brief_description: A small boy is invariably late for school because he stops to watch things that interest him on the way. the problem is solved by impressing on him that school is merely another way of learning about interesting things - and by arranging for two schoolmates to meet him every morning and walk to school with him.

results.title: Standing waves and the principle of superposition
results.creator_credit: Ron Sorri and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates what happens when waves meet and how a standing wave is formed by the superposition of identical travelling waves in opposite directions.

results.title: Standing Up for Joe (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.
results.description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.

results.title: Standards at work; Living with standards
results.brief_description: Describes what Australian Standards are and how they affect everyone’s lives. Standards at work shows their use in improving product quality and Australias’ competitive edge and introduces the Supplier Assessment and Standards Mark Schemes. Living with standards shows how they are written, where they are applied, the principles of standardization and how they promote better quality in products and services.

results.title: Stalin: the power of fear
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
results.brief_description: Examines the price of Stalinism in the aftermath of World War II: possibly between forty and eighty million lives lost in wars, starvation, execution, and unnecessary deaths. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Stalin: man and image
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the image Stalin created by exploring the man, his rise to power and his place in history. Historical perspective is provided by use of classic film footage showing the 1917 Russian Revolution, Lenin, Trotsky and Stalin. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Stairway to heaven
results.brief_description: This film deals with the study of astronomy from the time of the early Egyptians and Greeks, through the Middle Ages, when Galileo’s asertion that the earth moved revolutionised science, until the present day. The discovery of the telescope, and its development to the precision instrument it is today, is dealt with in detail.
